name: Thomas DARTOE, Petitioner v. Superintendent, Michael OVERMEYER AT, SCI-Forest, and the District Attorney of the County of Philadelphia, and the Attorney General of the State of Pennsylvania, Respondents

pin_cites.parenthetical: explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted
explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted

parties: Thomas DARTOE, Petitioner v. Superintendent, Michael OVERMEYER AT, SCI-Forest, and the District Attorney of the County of Philadelphia, and the Attorney General of the State of Pennsylvania, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 15th day of April, 2016, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Ali, 608 Pa. 71, 10 A.3d 282 (2010) (explaining that hybrid representation is not permitted).
The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
134 A.3d 1045
Thomas DARTOE, Petitioner v. Superintendent, Michael OVERMEYER AT, SCI-Forest, and the District Attorney of the County of Philadelphia, and the Attorney General of the State of Pennsylvania, Respondents.
No. 10 EM 2016.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 15, 2016.
